perturbation.original_text:
The present Agreement is effective as from 1 January 2009. It is established by calendar year and renewed tacitly every year.


The Agreement rests, for all that, cancellable at any time by any of the parties before the expiry date of the Agreement or any of its
renewals, upon three months prior written notice.
perturbation.changed_text:
The present Agreement is effective as from 1 January 2009. The agreement will be automatically extended annually for successive one-year terms, unless either party provides written notice of non-renewal at least three months prior to the end of the then-current term.


Notwithstanding the above, the Agreement may only be cancelled under unforeseen circumstances and requires negotiation between both parties before any termination can be finalized.
perturbation.explanation: The original text implies automatic renewal but allows cancellation with three months' notice. The modified text initially reinforces automatic renewal with specific terms. However, it then contradicts this by requiring 'unforeseen circumstances' and 'negotiation' for cancellation, creating uncertainty about the actual renewal and termination process. Is it automatic, or subject to unforeseen events and negotiation?

perturbation.original_text:
EIT is responsible for any damages caused to the Customer or to third parties, when these result from EIT not satisfying the
contractual obligations.


Nevertheless, EIT will be free of responsibility, in case of not satisfying its obligations, if he can prove that this was due to force
majeure or external causes out of his control, like accidents, natural disasters, vandalism acts or theft.


The liability of EIT will be limited to a value equal to contractual value as per clause 7.1 and will not exceed this value.
perturbation.changed_text:
EIT is generally responsible for damages caused to the Customer or third parties, when these result from EIT not satisfying the contractual obligations.


EIT will also be free of responsibility, in case of not satisfying its obligations, if he can prove that this was due to force majeure or external causes out of his control, like accidents, natural disasters, vandalism acts or theft. Furthermore, EIT is not responsible for any indirect, incidental, or consequential damages.

The liability of EIT is capped to a value equal to the fees paid by customer during the 12 months preceding the event that gave rise to the damages, but it will not apply to gross negligence or wilful misconduct from EIT.
perturbation.explanation: The original text establishes EIT's responsibility for damages, limited by the contractual value. The modified text introduces ambiguity with "generally responsible" and expands the exceptions by excluding "indirect, incidental, or consequential damages", in addition to force majeure. It also changes the liability cap calculation to fees paid during the preceding 12 months, and explicitly stating this cap does not apply in cases of gross negligence or wilful misconduct. This creates uncertainty as it is not clear about the calculation of the liability, and under which exact circumstances EIT can be liable.

perturbation.original_text:
The parties commit themselves to a total confidentiality and to not spread or use directly, through third parties or other companies,
information about the other party to which they have access in the frame of this Agreement.


PROTECTION AND CONFIDENTIALITY OF DATA


Confidential Information means any information disclosed by either party in the frame of this Agreement. In consequence,
each party agrees not to use, disclose, publish or disseminate any Confidential Information of the other party for any
purpose except to perform its obligations or exercise its rights under this Agreement, except:


Following prior consent of the other party, or


If the information was in the public domain at the time it was disclosed or becomes in the public domain
through no act or omission of the Receiving Party.


Except as provided hereinafter, for a period of five years after termination or expiration of this Agreement, each party shall
not disclose, publish or disseminate information received from the other party which may be required to carry out this
Agreement and which the disclosing party deems proprietary and confidential.
perturbation.changed_text:
The parties commit themselves to maintain confidentiality about the specific pricing terms outlined in this agreement, but are free to discuss the general nature of the services provided.


PROTECTION AND CONFIDENTIALITY OF DATA


Confidential Information means any information regarding the Customer's business operations and technical specifications that is explicitly marked as 'Confidential'. In consequence, each party agrees not to use, disclose, publish or disseminate any Confidential Information of the other party for any purpose except to perform its obligations or exercise its rights under this Agreement, except:

Following prior consent of the other party, or

If the information is required to be disclosed by law.

Each party shall not disclose, publish or disseminate information received from the other party which may be required to carry out this Agreement and which the disclosing party deems proprietary and confidential, unless the disclosing party no longer operates inside Group Villar Mir.
perturbation.explanation: The original text emphasizes 'total confidentiality.' The modified text contradicts this by allowing the discussion of the 'general nature of services' and only protecting 'explicitly marked' confidential information. Further, the additional exception that information can be disclosed if 'required by law' weakens the confidentality, and also the part that each party can disclose the other party's confidential information if it doesn't belong to Group Villar Mir anymore creates ambiguity. This introduces uncertainty as there is not total confidentiality anymore.
